content.description:
Place pro in cracks and pockets. Starts directly behind big tree. Originally climbed to the anchor for Faceplant when that was the only anchor on the wall.

First sent in the ‘late ‘90s.  The tree is 20 years bigger now  (as of 2019) and may need to be cut back if someone wants to try this.

It’s a fun and heady lead on gear only.

Originally published in the “Metal In Your Head” guidebook by Troy Anderson under the pen name Jack Tackle.
content.location: Start directly behind the big tree.

climbs.name: Too Much Cock Not Enough Lycra

content.description:
Misprinted in the guidebook as "Too much chalk not enough lycra".

Route starts on a strange and surprisingly delicate traverse through two bolts. You then move straight up the face. The crux of the route is found on the bulge right at the beginning. Once you move over the bulge you continue up a beautiful vertical face on edges with a pocket or two thrown in the mix. finishes with a short slab run to the chains. One of the best routes for the grade in Cedar Canyon.
content.location: The route is found up and left of the graveside matter wall slab. Start the traverse by scrambling up to the left nearly to the corner until you can easily gain access the ledge you will traverse.

content.description: Choose your pockets wisely early on to avoid a T on this OWL (it's soft so tread lightly) The sandstone does improve as you ascend, so keep climbing. When you get to the chains, you just might think this climb....hmm.... exceeds expectations.
content.location: next climb to the right of Dementor's Kiss

content.description:
Strange 5.10 up the dark corner left of Too Much Cock Not Enough Lycra. Some stemming and some fixed gear in there somewhere.

Originally published in the “Metal In Your Head” guidebook by TDA under the pen name Jack Tackle.
content.protection: Use trad and sport gear to ascend corner. Condition of anchor unknown.
content.location: Dark water streaked corner left of “Too Much Cock Not Enough Lycra”

content.description: This climbs a slab with small features. The clip from an undercling mono is great. It leads to the common anchor for most of the lines at Graveside Matter Wall.
content.location: This in the line in between Ghost Rider and Faceplant.

content.description:
Steep Friction slab. The route is fairly well protected but you won't want to fall before clipping the second bolt or you just might deck.

(This route was mistakenly called "widowmaker" in the new guidebook" widowmaker is an R rated trad route that climbs several feet to the right. According to the route creator you should be unable to clip any bolts from the original line that is widowmaker.)
content.location: Located just 10 feet right of Faceplant next to large tree.

content.description: Climb three bulges on perfect young limestone to rap anchors.  First bulge is surmounted by a committing mantle (pretty common to the Cedar Canyon slabs) and is safely bolted.  Bulge #2 requires that a pocket on the left be brushed out & mantle.  Dont step on the little tree & dont fall.  Bulge #3 has a great horizontal a foot or two back (clean the sand out), definately dont fall if you are just going to mantle. Run away from bulge #3 to the anchor.  It is great and prepares you for Psychoslabaddict and such.
content.protection: B & H...can be interpreted as about 3 or so Bolts and Hangers or Balls and a Helmet (typical of the Iron County Crew's routes)
content.location: the route is around the corner and 2 or 3 routes to the right of Ghost Rider (5.6) next to a tree.

content.description:
Slab climbing, the first moves are on smaller features then it moves up to easy ground on a large block then follows large edges to the top. Good first slab lead.

Can be top roped if you choose to walk out on the small ledge to anchors. There are bolts for protection to walk out onto the ledge.

If you are top roping be careful while setting up on the ledge, the area doesn't need another tragedy.
Steep friction slab.  Fun slab moves on small holds. Crux between first and second bolt.
content.location: Left of Widowmaker. (Second set of bolts from the large tree)

content.description: Multiple cruxes, starting with overhanging moves and finishing with thin, technical face climbing.  Its kinda sandy early on, but overall an awesome climb that may just suck out your soul; best to have your wand at the ready-->Expecto Patronum!!!!
content.location: bolted line to the right of "Too Much Chalk, Not Enough Lycra"
